sen.j: 源 師頼（みなもと の もろより、治暦4年（1068年） - 保延5年12月4日 (旧暦)（1139年12月26日））は、平安時代後期の公卿・歌人。
sen.e: Born in 1068, and gone on December 26, 1139, "MINAMOTO no Moroyori" was "Kugyo" (a top Court official) & a maker of Japanese poetry in the later Heian period.

sen.j: 備中国権介・左近少将・左右中弁などを歴任し、嘉保元年（1094年）6月蔵人頭になった。
sen.e: He held various positions, such as "Bicchu no kuni no gon no suke" (the provisional assistant governor of Bicchu Province), "Sakone no shosho" (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), "Sachuben" (Middle Controller of the Left) and "Uchuben" (Middle Controller of the Right), and in July (or August) 1094, he became "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain).

sen.j: しかし同年11月五節の儀において泥酔して帳台の戸を開けるという失態を犯して勘事に処されるという不祥事を起こす。
sen.e: However, in December 1094 (or January 1095) at Gosechi-festival, he got dead drunk and made a blunder of opening the door of a nobleman's room for living & sleeping, so he was forbidden to go to work at Court for some time.
sen.cmt: ※「勘事に処する」は、「出仕を差し止めされる」との意味に解して訳しています。（[www.weblio.jp/content/勘気］参照） なお、その後許されていることから、この「出仕差し止め」は一時的なものと解されます。
sen.e: However, in December 1094 (or January 1095) at Gosechi-festival, he became excessively drunk, accidentally opening the door to a nobleman's living quarters, and so was forbidden to work for the Court for some time.

sen.j: 承徳2年（1098年）参議に任ぜられ、最終官位は正二位大納言だった。
sen.e: In 1098, he was appointed to "Sangi" (Royal Adviser), and in the end, his Court rank & title rose to "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank) & "Dainagon" (Major Counselor).

sen.j: 議政官として右兵衛督・近江国権守・備前国権守・太皇太后宮（令子内親王）大夫・春宮（体仁親王、後の近衛天皇）大夫などを兼帯した。
sen.e: As a member of the decision-making committee within Grand Council of State, he additionally held various positions, such as "Uhyoe no kami" (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), "Omi no kuni no gon no kami" (the provisional governor of Omi Province), "Bizen no kuni no gon no kami" (the provisional governor of Bizen Province), "Taikotaigogu no daibu" (Master of the Household of Grand Empress Dowager [then, Imperial Princess Reishi]), and "Togu no daibu" (Master of the Quarters of Crown Prince [then, Imperial Prince Narihito, who later became Emperor Konoe]).
sen.cmt: ※「議政官」とは「太政官における意思決定機関」ですので、そのように訳しています。（なお、明治期に同じ言葉で「立法機関」を意味するものがありますが、これとは別物です。）
